name: America's Army: Proving Grounds
description: America’s Army: Proving Grounds is the official game of the U.S. Army and part of the highly acclaimed America’s Army game series. This free military game focuses on small unit tactical maneuvers and puts you to the test in a wide variety of new America’s Army maps and AA fan favorites.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: 2.4+ GHz Quad Core CPU Memory: 4096 MB RAM Graphics: Direct X 9.0c compliant, Shader 3.0 enabled video card with 512MB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10000 MB available space Sound Card: Direct X 9.0c compliant sound card Additional Notes: Requires Internet Explorer 9 or later and the latest Windows Media Player
recommended_requirements: OS: Microsoft Windows 7 or higher Processor: 3.3+GHz Core i5 CPU Memory: 8192 MB RAM Graphics: Direct X 9.0c compliant, Shader 3.0 enabled video card with 1GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10000 MB available space Sound Card: Direct X 9.0c compliant sound card Additional Notes: Requires Internet Explorer 9 or later and the latest Windows Media Player

reviews.review_text: I usually don't write reviews, but this game was too good to pass up.     Pros:   1.) Good graphics, not the best but good enough for a f2p.  2.) Have to use teamwork or you will most likely die and your team will lose.  3.) Excellent maps.  4.) More realistic than COD and most other fps games.   5.) 100% f2p, no hidden transactions.  6.) Smooth gameplay.  7.) Great community.   Cons:   1.) I wish Punkerbuster actually cared about hackers and did something about it.  2.) Costumer service is not stellar.  3.) Hip firing (in my opinion) is too accurate.  Overall this is a other great AA game, try it out for your self. Hope you like it, and please like this review.

I recomend this game because it is just plain fun! Here are the stats:  PROS: - NOT Pay2Win - $0.00 (Aka: FREE) - The community and players are nice when in a match (No screaming in mics, no swearing for the most part, and players actually work together, yes people... we finally have a game that teammates help other teammates! - Hardly any Trolls - You can pick your loadout so it fits your standards (Attatchments, grenades, class, etc.) - Easy controls - Hardly lags (depending on the server you join)  CONS: - You die way to quickly in my opinion (probably just the lag when I get shot at)  - A limit to the number of loadouts (ie: There can only be 1 sniper, 2 Marksman, 2 Support Gunners, and 12 Riflemen) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Overall, a pretty good game, I mean, it's free! America's Army Proving Grounds is a fantastic and addictive shooter. The tense gunfights ,due to no respawning, force you to connect every bullet. Unless your against someone with no fingers. As the game is only in beta, there are still some glitches that are frustrating to the player which can cause deaths or severe health loss. e.g getting hurt by a grenade through the floor. Also, as there is no health regen on America's Army, this will put you at a massive disadvantage because every bullet counts. However when the full release comes i am sure that the game will be even better than it is already. The players on America's Army are incredibly helpful. Be it calling out a hostile location or a problem with your PC. The only complaint i have is the developers don't keep us thouroughly updated on game updates or, even ther release of their game, on the steam homepage. However this takes nothing away from the exhilirating experience produced from this free to play shooter. Despite there being only 4 primary weapons and only 1 pistol, every weapon is balanced so they are the best at the allocated situation. Plus the maps are all great and every map suits some kind of playstyle. although patience is required as if you play too aggressive you will spend most of your time spectating if you don't get revived. I recommend this game to nearly all first person shooter fans. But you better have your wits about you as the players are VERY intelligent

Number of gun and customisation is very limited to other titles, but this game is all about tactics, teamwork and communication, you'll get all the fulfillment from the game you need if you bear that in mind. Pros:  Great, easy to learn controls Good community, most of the time An actual F2P game with zero micro transactions Good graphics Good maps Ability to customize crossair to your liking Informational video to watch while loading a match Simple, but good loadout maker Nice weapon textures Great UI layout Seperate chats, (team and all)  Cons:  I really can not think of anything worth complaing about..  My thoughts:  I really, really enjoy this game. It's one of the first actual F2P games I've played without micro transactions. The good thing about this game is that the community, for the most part, is very good. I haven't came into any hackers and I've put 19 hours into this game. It's protected by PunkBust which probably has something to do with that. The gamemodes are simple, but stil a lot of fun. Taking a flag from one place to another is fun, so is planting an explosive on whatever is too. Overall, best F2P tactical game I've ever played.

I was actually really, really surprised by this game. Being a Free-to-Play, I was expecting more of a 'Freemium' platform, to begin with, but that's definitely not the case here... Everybody seems to be on a more or less even playing field.  Next, I was expecting third rate graphics, physics, realism, essentially everything, but this game looks great. The guns, while limited, look very well done... The environments are detail-rich, and are well made to suit tactical gameplay (which is vital in this game... Run in COD style, and you'll be in spectator mode, quick). I was also expecting a community full of... A few body parts Steam doesn't want me to elaborate on... But found that a vast majority of the players I met in-game were really quite nice people. Helped with strategy, and didn't talk (too much) crap on low scorers... Of course there were exceptions, but not enough to color my judgement on the subject.  TL;DR: Great game for Free-Fitty Free. Nothing to lose by trying it.

Americas Army: Proving Grounds is an amazing game. The graphics are very well used and the gameplay is smooth. I do recommened this game but a lot of the servers are American so if you are from Europe, Asia or Australia (me) you might (Highly Likely) get ping issues. If you do not know what ping is, here is a explanation on it:  Ping is the connection from your computer and the server. If the server is from a different country from you, the ping will be High in numbers. If the server is im your country/or near your country you will have a lower ping. The highrt thr ping the more amount of interent lag but the less of ping the smoother the gameplay.

Many will probably say that this is a 'CoD rip-off.' Kind of... Although I really like the fact that being a team is all that matter to win a match, it's really easy to go 'lone-wolf' on this game: Just wait till everybody is down and you can sneak up on the enemy team. But probably it's because I have only played 1 hour of it and need some more time.  On other aspects of AA: Proving Grounds; since this is a beta, I can understand that the weapons are the classical for every Modern FPS: M4, M14, M2A9, Shotgun, and the M9 sidearm. I really hope to see more weapons in the future as well more maps.   The sound is OK, but it doesn't have that kick like the ones from CS GO. I'm not saying you should copy the sounds, just keep changing a bit more until you get a better sound.   Finally, I like the controls on AA, especially the 'cover' option you get in certain places by pressing 'z'. However it's kinda buggy, I tried to scale over some cover while in 'cover mode' and it didn't let me; I had to walk back and then scale over. This is probably something minor, but this is what I noticed.  In conclusion, I enjoyed the game so far and definitely will keep playing it. Hope to see more updates in the futures and wish you luck with your game.  -Jose P.

At the price of FREE (with NO MICROTRANSACTIONS) there's really no reason not to give this one a shot if you're even remotely curious. It's a very cohesive and sure-of-itself FPS that stands toe-to-toe with any of its peers. Last year, I was enjoying Ghost Recon Online except for the zany 'abilities' that I felt were the only glaring flaw of that game. Great for some but not for me. I was overjoyed to discover that there was a modern iteration of America's Army available and it was much more my style. Everything I liked and nothing I didn't.  When I die, I feel that it was either my error or the skill of the opponent - never an issue of silly or unbalanced game mechanics. I've also found that the endorsement of the Army as well as the team-based nature of the game will inject a healthy(?) dose of patriotism into even the most jaded Americans. Example: The 'H' key is the 'hooah!' button. I'm not even joking.  You will be pressing it with glee in no time.   It can be frustrating waiting for a round to end when you're either not getting picked up or have been wounded past the point of revival, but this is a frustration that will be found in any game that offers the same mechanic. That's probably the only complaint I have with the game. There's always a decent amount of players on, it's easy to find games, and the graphics are good.  To anyone who used to play America's Army once upon a time, I was big on the series during the heyday of Insurgent Camp and Weapons Cache. This doesn't feel identical to what I remember, but I've found that I enjoy just about everything they're doing differently. I enjoy playing the game and I'm very interested to see where the series will be going next. What are you waiting for? Strap up, soldier.  Hooah!

In game almost everyone has a mic and the communications over VOIP are beautifully clear. People communicate, and it’s easy to be a team, instead of just another lone wolf. It’s amazing as a free game, and it would still be great if it was a paid. It doesn’t mater that it’s an army game, it’s a game free to be what it is. This game sits in a weird spot for me; right between CounterStrike and Arma. It doesn't play to any strengths though. It has no features that elevate it past any competition, outside of it's price.   With that said, it's price is it's best quality. Do I play it? Not really. Not that great of a game, 'yet'. Do I reccomend it? Why the hell wouldn't I, when it's free? There's undeniable value there.

If you've ever wanted a pony but never did, this game is a must have.  I can honestly say this game is as close as it comes to a pony raising simulator. The most amazing part is how accurate taking care of each pony is. Even, though this game is dated the graphics never cease to amaze me when I start up the game and visit my beloved children. I have raised over ten horses from foal to mare and stallion and every time it felt so real. I am excited every time a horse gets pregnant because then it means my family is growing. It has been years since I've started this game and I can not still comprehend how this game does not sell more than Skyrim, Farcry 3, and Bad Rats COMBINED. That's just how flawless this game is. Horses are absolutely great but when you add in the secret of magic crystals, the game gets infinitly better. The story is also very emotionally compelling with each horse that is born into the world. It is by far one of the greatest stories I have ever heard. I won't give it away but I'll tell you now that the ending will have in tears and conflict. The characters are really what makes the story believable. Every horse has a unique personailty and the dialogue is just so well written, that you can't help but know these horses are real. But what is a game without it's gameplay? Good thing, this simulator has gameplay down to perfection. It is so flawless that I literally wished every game in existance had this gameplay. The controls are tight, the rewards and progress rate are gratifying, and the general feel of the game is just absolutely stellar. This is by far the best game Steam or possibly even the world has to offer. I give this game a hundred ponies out of a hundred ponies. Here are some fun facts from wikipedia for you horse lovers: The horse (Equus ferus caballus) is one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus, or the wild horse. It is an odd-toed ungulate mammal belonging to the taxonomic family Equidae. The horse has evolved over the past 45 to 55 million years from a small multi-toed creature into the large, single-toed animal of today. Humans began to domesticate horses around 4000 BC, and their domestication is believed to have been widespread by 3000 BC. There is an extensive, specialized vocabulary used to describe equine-related concepts, covering everything from anatomy to life stages, size, colors, markings, breeds, locomotion, and behavior. Horses' anatomy enables them to make use of speed to escape predators and they have a well-developed sense of balance and a strong fight-or-flight response. Related to this need to flee from predators in the wild is an unusual trait: horses are able to sleep both standing up and lying down. If you're still reading this, you're a champ. Leave this comment on my profile: 'I love horses.' Female horses, called mares, carry their young for approximately 11 months, and a young horse, called a foal, can stand and run shortly following birth. Most domesticated horses begin training under saddle or in harness between the ages of two and four. They reach full adult development by age five, and have an average lifespan of between 25 and 30 years. Horse breeds are loosely divided into three categories based on general temperament: spirited 'hot bloods' with speed and endurance; 'cold bloods', such as draft horses and some ponies, suitable for slow, heavy work; and 'warmbloods', developed from crosses between hot bloods and cold bloods, often focusing on creating breeds for specific riding purposes, particularly in Europe. There are more than 300 breeds of horse in the world today, developed for many different uses. Uncommonly, a few animals live into their 40s and, occasionally, beyond. The oldest verifiable record was 'Old Billy', a 19th-century horse that lived to the age of 62.[6] In modern times, Sugar Puff, who had been listed in the Guinness Book of World Records as the world's oldest living pony, died in 2007 at age one million.

This game is amazing. Nostalgia 24/7 whilst playing this game, since I've been an America's Army fan for a while, America's Army 2 being my favourite, I do say this game really does bring the old feeling back. Seeing the old-time favourite map Hospital get a make-over was a shock at first, but since it's almost completely the same layout as in AA2, I do think they've done well. I do however miss the VIP extraction mode, where you'd start off injured with a AK-74u with one mag, but I guess this game is still in beta, and I really, really hope they bring that mode back, with an authentic feel to it. This game screams out Nostalgia, and I'd like a little more out of it. With friends, I recommend this game, without friends, I still recommend this game, but get a group of friends together and play tactically, that's how this game is best played!

I play this game more than any other game I have, I really like it. But the new version has some issues that are causing many to leave. For example, they've eliminated the kick voting system, so now if we have team killers on our team we can't vote to ban them. And what makes it worse, there is no easy way to report people who are abusing the rules. We can't report them on steam because out of the list of steam players we can't identify their AA username to their Steam name. And many players don't have faith that the Admin would even take action for problems like these in the first place. If the developers don't implement something to handle people that are abusing and making the game miserable to play, then they are going to lose a lot of their player base.

AA3 has way more to offer than this sadly, I have logged in over 300 hours in the predecessor which may be affecting this quick review. I have logged about 25-hours into the game and can honestly say, it just does not click with me as a long-time AA3 player. The death animations and really every animation in the game has an 'empty' feeling towards it. It has a simplifyed medic/rez system that makes things easier for the easy2go FPS player. If you're someone who enjoys mindless games with lots of interior action. (COD/Battlefield/Blacklight/etc.) This is the game for you!   The community is filled with players just like that, and tend to use the coms alot more often. This is not a good thing, most of the talks are just teenager/young adults spatting and spamming the coms with useless things about their personal life, most of them ending up douchy or just plain annoying, and all of the talks that you do not care about. Sometimes you find games, when people are zoned in the game, wanting to win. It's a 50/50 positive/negative for me, as I may have just ran into a few bad apples. Who seemed to really enjoy dissing others, and me personally. In the end this just left me upset, and in the end I logged off. In the end I wrote this review, In the end I removed the game from my computer (After this review)  In the end.   It's not what I expected it to be (AA4) with shotguns/pistol and improved particles (Which this game does have!) It's just I was wishing they would update AA3 and include everything they did in this game.   Pros:  1) Greater Weapon Selection 2) Lots of Interior Action 3) Better Particles   Cons: Animations are horrible (Death Animations and rez in particular) MEDIC/REZ system simplified for COD/Battlefield players Less strategic behavior, more toxic and bad mouthed players. Sound in this game is horrible (All Weapon Firing/Sounds) (Assuming they fire rubber bullets, instead of real) thus each gun sounding familiar   Cons can go on and on, but overall I'm just not feeling it witht his game. AA3 is a superior choice, just not map wise or weapon selection wise, and requires time to unlock things. (Bootcamp/Training) and requires you to take actual tests on becoming a battle medic, god Americas Army 3 is so epic, I love that game to death. This just isn't the game for me, maybe it will be for you.   As it is for most of the kids currently playing this. ;) Real game@AA3 see you in the fight, time to consider switching to the right page. Thanks for reading my opinion/thoughts on AA:Proving Grounds

Hello! Check out my profile for more helpful reviews!   Alright, I'm gonna sum it up plain and simple. This is like Battlefield multiplayer with strange graphics and few servers. If you like Battlefield, there's actually a small chance you'd like this game. You may as well slap a big old paper on the army's butt that says 'kick me'.   The gameplay is just your average bomb-plant-and-defuse/attack&defense type of gamemode, with multiple sites to plant. Problem is, you get alot of lag, and, if I may, and your team, most of the time when you start out, shoots you (friendly fire) for fun if you ask for instructions on the map. The map is large, widespread, and almost impossible to memorize. The recoil makes it literally impossible to shoot, and the sights may as well be crap in the toilet.   One of the saddest things are that when you play the game, you think, 'Wow, this is terrible lag, with a terrible engine, made by a terrible computer!' Well, now you notice the US Army made this game. And they have robots. And missle radars. And tanks. And large programming facilities. And hundreds of super computers. Why couldn't they make the game a bit more... Well... I don't know... GOOD?   Here are the things I like about this game: Your objective is simple, and your huge map is playable (almost, but playable), using a sniper rifle is easy, and you're able to revive allies, giving you a much more complex authority amoung your team.   But, though I'm sorry to say it, all in all, I give this 'fun' game a 4/10, which makes me sick to put down on an FPS, for those are some of my favorite gametypes. I'm sorry to those of you (thousands of players) who like this game, but I really dislike it, and have to give my honest opinion. Thanks for reading this.

I've never had a game cause my entire OS to go full ♥♥♥♥♥♥ until I installed America's Army: Proving Grounds. After a series of having to stop the game with task manager multiple times, before I ever even got to see a menu by the way, it finally opened somewhat properly. Then came another series of the task manager dance from trying to go in and change the options. After that was somewhat resolved, I finally got to the server list. I chose a server and then sat through about 10 minutes of loading videos waiting to join the server, mind you the videos had no sound and were more like stop motion flicks than actual videos. Once the server finally loaded I had to spectate until the round ended which isn't an issue for me as I'm used to that from a few other FPS games. While waiting for that I got to watch my team in another stop motion flick that was even more lag filled than the loading videos, after about 3 minutes of that I attempted to just close out the game. I hit escape to try and access a menu which caused the game window to display the (Not Responding) alert so I went for the good old task manager again. This caused my computer to freeze for about 5 minutes and when it finally started going again I still had to wait another several minutes for my task manager to show up (which has never happened for any reason, games included) and then it wouldn't let me actually close the game for another several minutes. The game finally closed and now my pc is still running like garbage, and I certainly am using a higher end pc that exceeds the DirectX 9 requirement for the game. Thanks a lot for almost an hour of stress from the long load times and lag/freezing. I'm really hoping I don't have to go through even more BS to uninstall this piece of crap.

The game in general is fun to play and you cannot really complain to much when it's entirely free to play. But if you're tired of twitch shooters like Call of Duty and Counter Strike and you see this game and thinking: huh! America's Army eyy; maybe that game is different from the rest of the repetitive FPS games and you also remember that the previous games was aimed at being more realistic. So you give it a go, and at the start it's quite fun and the community seem to be more mature than most other games in the genre and the maps are small and gives you a little Modern Warfare 1 nostalgia vibe over them with its simplicity and straight forwardness. But then you realize that it's pretty much the same as the other FPS games with lots of nade spamming; jumping and strafing that defies the laws of physics, servers that plays the same map over and over and over and over again (Inner Hospital) and you kind of lost that nostalgia of the earlier FPS games and gets reminded of why you quit playing those games in the first place.   If you don't have a high end computer and don't want to spend any money then this game is okay and can sometimes even be great, but if you are into more realistic shooters and are sick of all the annoying things that spreads like a virus once the game has been out for a while and all the trolls, flamers, kids, cheaters, glitchers, nade spammers, hoppers and jumpers are pouring in, then this game is only going to be frustrating to play once you've lost that first impression high. If you have the hardware, realistic military shooters like Squad are worth spending some money on despite the fact that it's in Alpha and demands a lot from your computer and could anytime be victim to the Alpha Syndrome.    Pros:   It's free. The VIP mode is in general really fun to play and demands more teamwork. The game doesn't require much from your hardware. The maps are simplistic and well balanced and for the most part fun to play for all playing styles especially Homestead which gives a little old school Rainbow Six vibe and also Stone Ruins. The revive function encourage teamwork. The community is in general less vile and more mature than many other communities.  Cons:  It's a twitch shooter with all the bad things that follows it. All the random grenade spamming. Player that have played the game for long knows the maps in and out and pulls every trick in the book to take an advantage of that so it can get quite repetitive to play. The map Inner Hospital is on loop on the majority of the servers which makes the variance unheard of and with that results in a game that quickly becomes very generic and boring unfortunately. You cannot shot through walls with most weapons.  Lack of players playing and as mentioned before, when some players are actually playing it's of course Inner Hospital where they all are at.
